> From: Melanie Johnson <melanie_6602@...>
> Subject: RE: VIRUS WARNING
>
>
> I only check this email address from work, and the computers here are fine.
> "LAINE. Mikael (Nol)" <laine@...> wrote:Heh, it's a good idea not to use your computer when you know you are infected with a virus, at least it's a good idea to stay away from the net to avoid spreading the virus.-----Original Message-----
> From: Melanie Johnson [mailto:melanie_6602@...]
> Sent: den 30 oktober 2002 16:23
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [EverQuest] VIRUS WARNING
>
>
> Thanks for posting that link. Now maybe I can finally get rid of my Klez virus.
> Matthew Bond <mattgbond@...> wrote: I was infected by a virus, which I have now cleaned from my system.
> Please delete any messages from me that you recived within the last few
> days, without opening them. I advise you to check your system for the
> Klez or Bugbear viruses. You can download a free utility for cleaning
> these viruses here:
>
> http://vil.nai.com/vil/stinger/
>
> Matt
>

> Message: 3

> From: David Langille <tuxedomystery2000@...>
> Subject: Re: Digest Number 618
>

> "Somebody who was in the Disney beta "
> Disney Beta?
> Jenn <juniper.jot@...> wrote:> Message: 5
>

yeah, there's a MMOG for kids being developed by Disney.


> Message: 4
> Date: Thu, 31 Oct 2002 08:10:47 -1000
> From: "Steve C." <cotten@...>
> Subject: Re: Re: Digest Number 618
>
> Hi all!
>
> I'm also a Beta tester. I'm 51. I was reading the posts on the Beta website
> and the oldest person is 64, (so far), so all ages enjoy the game. Hope you
> are wrong about people not playing because of difficulty getting hooked up.
> Can you buy the network adapter online? I haven't started yet. When they
> send the disks I'll get the adapter but I'm wondering if it will be hard to
> find here in Hawaii. If they were smart they would make sure places like
> Wal-Mart had em.
>
> See ya in the game!
> Steve
>

I would suggest you get on Ebay today and try to get a Network Adapter.
Don't depend on Wal-mart. Especially since you can't just drive to
the next state to check there, too. Some places the adapters are easy
to find, some places they fly off the shelves before they even come in.

I live in Baltimore, Maryland and I couldn't find one here. Bought mine
off Ebay. Or go out looking now, don't wait till you get the DVD in the
mail, you may not be able to find it then and you'll be wanting to play.
Hope you find one.
